00008  * This module is fairly stand-alone: the header file "helpers.h"
00009  * just provides debug macros so it can easily be bypassed/replaced.
00010  *
00011  */
00012 
00013 #include "../includes/helpers.h"
00014 #include "../includes/queue.h"

00017 /**
00018  * Creates a queue
00019  */
00020 queue *queue_create(void) {
00021 
00022         // if this malloc fails,
00023         //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00024         pthread_mutex_t *mutex = malloc( sizeof(pthread_mutex_t) );
00025         queue *q = malloc( sizeof(queue) );
00026         if ((NULL != q) && (NULL!=mutex)){
00027 
00028                 q->head  = NULL;
00029                 q->tail  = NULL;
00030 
00031                 pthread_mutex_init( mutex, NULL );
00032                 q->mutex = mutex;
00033         }
00034 
00035         return q;
00036 }// init
00037 
00038 /**
00039  * Safely destroys a queue
00040  */
00041 void queue_destroy(queue *q) {
00042 
00043         if (NULL!=q)
00044                 free(q);
00045 }
00046 
00047 /**
00048  * Queues a message in the communication queue
00049  *
00050  * Returns 1 on success, 0 on error
00051  */
00052 int queue_put(queue *q, void *msg) {
00053 
00054         queue_node *tmp=NULL;
00055 
00056         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: BEGIN");
00057 
00058         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00059 
00060                 // if this malloc fails,
00061                 //  there are much bigger problems that loom
00062                 tmp = (queue_node *) malloc(sizeof(queue_node));
00063                 if (NULL==tmp)
00064                         return 0;
00065 
00066                 tmp->msg = msg;
00067 
00068                 //perform the ''put'' operation {
00069                         //no next yet...
00070                         tmp->next=NULL;
00071 
00072                         //insert pointer to element first
00073                         if (NULL!=q->tail)
00074                                 (q->tail)->next=tmp;
00075 
00076                         // insert element
00077                         q->tail = tmp;
00078 
00079                         //was the queue empty?
00080                         if (NULL==q->head)
00081                                 q->head=tmp;
00082                 //}
00083 
00084         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00085 
00086         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_put: END");
00087 
00088         return 1;
00089 }//[/queue_put]
00090 
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * Retrieves the next message from the communication queue
00094  * Returns NULL if none.
00095  */
00096 void *queue_get(queue *q) {
00097 
00098         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00099         void *msg=NULL;
00100 
00101         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get: BEGIN");
00102 
00103         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00104 
00105                 tmp = q->head;
00106                 if (tmp!=NULL) {
00107                         q->head = q->head->next;
00108                         msg = tmp->msg;
00109                         free(tmp);
00110                         doLog(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get: MESSAGE PRESENT");
00111                 }
00112 
00113         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00114 
00115         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_get: END");
00116 
00117         return msg;
00118 }//[/queue_get]
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * Verifies if a message is present
00122  *
00123  * Returns 1 if at least 1 message is present
00124  */
00125 int queue_peek(queue *q) {
00126 
00127         queue_node *tmp = NULL;
00128         int result = 0;
00129 
00130         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_peek: BEGIN");
00131 
00132         pthread_mutex_lock( q->mutex );
00133 
00134                 tmp = q->head;
00135                 result = (tmp!=NULL);
00136 
00137         pthread_mutex_unlock( q->mutex );
00138 
00139         //DEBUG_LOG(LOG_DEBUG,"queue_peek: END");
00140 
00141         return result;
00142 } // queue_peek
